data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549005,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T05:00:45.091Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOur team tested a simple auto today and we’re having some issues. At first, we just had an auto that went straight back and made our elevator go up. It did go back, but it also had a rotation that was not added. After that, we thought that our issue might have been from the poseEstimator being 90 degrees off so we removed the 90 gyro offset. After that, the auto started going the opposite way from what was expected, and the poseEstimator did not match the path that the robot took (was mirrored) and it was facing 180 degrees off from the robot.  Also our poseEstimate position is completely correct during teleop. Any help solving this would be greatly appreciated.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T05:10:15.220Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":44.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494457,"topic_slug":"problems-with-autos","display_username":"Simon Kozioziemski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-autos/494457/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3549034,"name":"Justin Buist","username":"Justin_Buist","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T05:19:18.798Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhen debugging these things I’ve found AdvantageScope along with liberal logging of everything on the robot quite helpful. In its simplest form that’s just smashing everything out to SmartDashboard.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBeing able to replay what was happening on the bot every 0.02 seconds is quite helpful.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt also never hurts to post your code. It’s good practice to keep it updated on a Github repo anyhow. But, the reason for that is it’s generally really hard to code in a bug like you’re describing in any way that looks intentional and not notice. So, it’s always something happening that you don’t even see yourself and that makes it hard to report back to the group what’s really happening in the code.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T05:19:18.798Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494457,"topic_slug":"problems-with-autos","display_username":"Justin Buist","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24678,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/problems-with-autos/494457/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551066,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T06:36:25.116Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSorry for not replying.
